attributes.action: ban the 'reverse chicane' traffic calming design and to institute an appeals procedure for contentious traffic calming schemes and local road designs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
'Reverse chicanes', with the buildout on one side of the road and the give-way line on the other, have been built in Colehill, Dorset. They are viewed as dangerous as they contradict standard driving practice, which is to give way if the obstacle is on your side.

The local authority has the final word on them, and at present will not remove or amend them in spite of many requests.

We believe 'reverse chicanes' are potentially so dangerous they should be banned, and we see the need for an appeals procedure in cases like this.
